definition: to practice medicine (esp. in private practice)
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
medical/medicine/doctor/to cure/to treat

sentences.english: She has been doctoring since before you were born.
sentences.chinese: 從你們出生前至今，她一直在行醫。

sentences.english: He was the first one graduated in China medical school and became a practitioner i…
sentences.chinese: 他還是第一個取得香港行醫執照的中國醫學堂畢業生。

sentences.english: He doctored in Chinatown for many years.
He was licensed to practice as a doctor．
She practised medicine in Xiamen, Fujian Province.
It is learnt that the pilot Zuotang practise in our province will also start.
sentences.chinese: 據悉，坐堂行醫試點也將在我省啓動。

sentences.english: It is they who encourage me not only to practice medicine but also study life.
sentences.chinese: 不但行醫，也鼓勵着我研究人生。

sentences.english: He is a Chinese medical practitioner with 70 years of working experiences.
sentences.chinese: 民間草醫，年青時拜許多名師，行醫70多年。

sentences.english: Practitioners may not be certified or licensed.
sentences.chinese: 傳統醫務人員可能未獲認證，或無照行醫。

sentences.english: Hopefully they've cleared it up a little bit.
Once someone was certified they could be a doctor for 50 years, the way the current system works.
sentences.chinese: 按照現行制度，行醫執照的有效期爲50年。

sentences.english: The author proposed that the crime of illegal medical practice is also an non-statutory offence to intent.
sentences.chinese: 分析了非法行醫罪也是一種非法定目的犯。

sentences.english: For this reason I have decided to take practicing medicine as my future career.
sentences.chinese: 基於這個理由，我已決訂把行醫作爲未來的職業。

sentences.english: No. 336, Section l of our country's penal code set up illegal practice medicine crime newly.
sentences.chinese: 我國現行刑法典336條第一款新設了非法行醫罪。

sentences.english: Last year the GMC struck off a total of 60 doctors.
sentences.chinese: 去年，醫療委員會共取消了60名醫生的行醫資格。

sentences.english: She practiced medicine in Xiamen, Fujian Province.

definition: famous doctor
(Tw) to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
to do one's duty/to do one's bit conscientiously
medical expertise/art of healing
to receive training
scholar/learned person
to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
to learn a skill or art
to reform and start afresh (idiom); to turn over a new leaf
guard home, defend the country (idiom); national defense
to seek one's livelihood/to work to support oneself/to earn a living
the press/the media
medicine (as a science)/medical science
social work
to be duty bound/to be one's unshirkable responsibility
